instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01987: What is 820-01987? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U6903: What is U6903? This chip is responsible for creating PP3V3_G3H in 2016-2018 model Macbook logic boards.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_G3H: What is PP3V3_G3H? PP3V3_G3H is a 3.3v power line that is present when the machine is in a Global System Hardware Off state, and should come on before most other rails so that the USB-C circuitry can be powered for the charger.
definitions.PP5V_G3S: What is PP5V_G3S? PP5V_G3S is a 5v power rail present when the system is in a G3S standby state.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Freezes on apple logo
threads.message:
Macbook Pro 2020 Intel <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>

Hi! This Mac was filled with liquid and in the previous service it was cleaned of dirt. The Mac started to turn on, but after 5-7 seconds it turned off completely at the apple logo. I cleaned it up again. It had the J6801 trackpad connector torn off and I soldered it back on. After Revive in DFU, the computer began to enter the Recovery download window and asks to connect to a Wifi network (DFU via Air M1). If you enter the password for wifi, then the Mac will freeze tightly in a few seconds and will not react to anything. It may hang during the process of entering a password or choosing a network.

In the previous service it seems that <CHIP>U6903</CHIP> was soldered, but I did not notice anything suspicious anymore. There are no signs of corrosion on the board. Booting from an external drive does not work, it just hangs on the apple logo until a disk is selected. Tell me what should I do next? What should be measured? Consumption on the USB-C tester when the Mac freezes 673-680mA. Thanks!!!!

When the Mac freezes when entering a password:
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = 11.045v
<SIGNAL>PP0V95_S0_CPUVCCIO_REG_R</SIGNAL> = 0.954v
<SIGNAL>PPVCCSA_CPU_R</SIGNAL> = 0.806v
<SIGNAL>PPVCC_CPU_PH1</SIGNAL> = 1.113v
<SIGNAL>PPVCC_CPU_PH2</SIGNAL> = 1.116v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> = 3.302v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_G3S</SIGNAL> = 5.114v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3S_WLANBT</SIGNAL> = 3.305v
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_G3S_WLANBT</SIGNAL>=1.802v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Freezes on apple logo
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

Did you try DFU restore too?
It will erase SSD, but may be last option.
Check if is possible to recover data in Target Disk mode, if needed.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Freezes on apple logo
threads.message: Yes, I have tried this.  The last time ended with an error.  Only Revive passes without problems.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Freezes on apple logo
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Freezes on apple logo
threads.message:
There can be SSD problems.
Can you acces it in Target Disk mode?
If yes, check for errors.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Freezes on apple logo
threads.message: Okay.  I'll check it out as soon as possible.  I'll answer later

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Freezes on apple logo
threads.message: I can't get into Target disk mode. There is no reaction to holding the T button, it just loads into the wifi connection window

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Freezes on apple logo
threads.message:
I suppose an SSD issue, if you can't finish DFU restore.
Should be good to test the board in known good shell, to discard accessories problem.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Freezes on apple logo
threads.message: With the lid closed and external display I started entering recovery but stopped after an hour with an error -2003f.  I made another attempt to revive and restore but both failed.  now poppy 20v 30-60mA and nothing more.  very strange[ATTACH type="full"]60723[/ATTACH][ATTACH type="full"]60724[/ATTACH]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Freezes on apple logo
threads.message:
Disconnect internal LCD (J8500), don't keep the lid closed.

You can't go ahead before complete DFU.
If now lost image and fails even Revive, may have T2 internal problem, or SSD.
